title: Gallery Talk: One Hundred Views of Tokyo—Message to the 21st Century
title_display: Gallery Talk: One Hundred Views of Tokyo—Message to the 21st Century
hero_caption: Toneyama Kojin. Tokyo Rhapsody, 1993. Louise A. Lutz Endowment and Asian Art Council Acquisition funds.
description:
A newly acquired set of prints produced between 1989 and 1999 by one hundred Japanese print artists meditates on the turn of the millennium while celebrating Japan's great woodblock printing tradition. Explore selections from the series with educator Lucas Livingston.

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an e-mail to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program. 

Please note that the image on this page is for reference purposes only and may not be featured during the gallery talk.
